intro: Koanophyllon paucicrenatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, and the leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Koanophyllon paucicrenatum is an important plant for pollinators and is also used in traditional medicine by some indigenous communities.
